name: cub
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a young lion, bear, wolf, etc.: A mother bear is fiercely protective of her cubs. a lion/tiger/panda/fox/wolf cub
More examplesFewer examplesSeven healthy panda cubs were born in the reserve last year. The film shows a fox and her cubs playing in the forest.Many polar bear cubs do not survive.A killer whale surfaces to catch a seal cub on the shore.

Cubs [ U ] (also Cub Scouts)
the section of the Scouts, an international organization for young people, that is for children aged between eight and eleven years old: At the age of about ten and a half you will move on from Cubs to Scouts.
a meeting of Cubs: Dad will pick you up from Cubs today.
See more
[ C ] (also Cub Scout) a child aged between eight and eleven years old who is a member of the Cubs organization: Cubs are expected to help others in their community, as well as having fun and learning new skills. His eight-year-old son Jack is a Cub Scout.
